summary: Gale Lynn Oppenberg was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). Her name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from April 1978 to January 1979. These documents list her name, social security number, position within the committee, annual salary, and gross pay for the specified periods. The consistent appearance of her name across these payroll documents indicates her sustained employment with the SCA during the period under review.
significance: Gale Lynn Oppenberg's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. While the documents do not specify her exact role, her presence on payroll and certification reports confirms her involvement in the committee's operations during its investigation into the JFK assassination. The documents do not provide enough information to determine the specific nature or impact of her work.
